iqstracing
Class TracingEngine

java.lang.Object
  iqstracing.TracingEngine

public class TracingEngine
extends java.lang.Object

TracingEngine is the class which will control the tracing system for each application. It keeps information about the application being used, its user and the logged session. It controls the order of the traced events and adds the time at which the information was traced. The TracingEngine class provides a set of methods which allow keeping a collection of tracers and giving the information to be traced to them. By default, it traces to console.

Code license: GNU General Public License v2

Author:
Núria Coronas, Jordi Cuadros

Constructor Detail

TracingEngine

public TracingEngine(java.lang.String application,
                     java.lang.String user,
                     java.lang.String session)
Constructs a TracingEngine object using the specified string values of application, user and session, which will be assigned to their respective fields. The application can never be null, and in this case the tracing status is set to false, so that nothing can be traced. If the user or session are null, they will be randomly created.

Parameters:
application - string that represents the program or java applet that requests the tracing of an event or state
user - string representing the person who is using the application and whose actions are being traced
session - string that represents the logged session

TracingEngine

public TracingEngine(java.lang.String application,
                     java.lang.String user)
Constructs a TracingEngine object using the specified string values of application and user. The value of session is not specified, so it will be created from the user string and a random sequence of six characters which can be capital letters or numbers.

Parameters:
application - string that represents the program or java applet that requests the tracing of an event or state
user - string representing the person who is using the application and whose actions are being traced

TracingEngine

public TracingEngine(java.lang.String application)
Constructs a TracingEngine object using only the specified string value of application. The values of user and session are not specified. The user field will be filled with a randomly created sequence of six characters that can be capital letters or numbers. The session field will be the user string concatenated to a random sequence of six characters.

Parameters:
application - string that represents the program or java applet that requests the tracing of an event or state
Method Detail

startTracingToFile

public void startTracingToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Checks there is not already a FileTracer object for the specified fileName (full path) in the tracerCollection. In case the FileTracer object exists, nothing is done. If the desired tracer does not exist, it is created and added to the tracerCollection.

Parameters:
fileName - string representing the name of the file where the information will be traced.

stopTracingToFile

public void stopTracingToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Checks there is a FileTracer for this fileName (full path) in the tracerCollection. In case the FileTracer does not exist, nothing is done. If the FileTracer exists, it is removed from the tracerCollection.

Parameters:
fileName - string representing the name of the file where the information has been traced.

startTracingToConsole

public void startTracingToConsole()
Checks there is not already a ConsoleTracer in the tracerCollection. In case the ConsoleTracer exists, nothing is done. If the desired tracer does not exist, it is created and added to the tracerCollection.

stopTracingToConsole

public void stopTracingToConsole()
Checks there is a ConsoleTracer in the tracerCollection. In case the ConsoleTracer does not exist, nothing is done. If the tracer exists, it is removed from the tracerCollection.

trace

public void trace(Event event)
Traces the information stored in an event adding information about the time when the trace was written and the logged application, user and session. For each tracer in the tracerCollection, its trace(Event) method is called to produce the desired tracing. It only traces if tracingStatus is true and the name of the action which the event represents is specified.

Parameters:
event - Event object that stores all the information about the action that will be traced

trace

public void trace(State state)
Traces the information stored in a state adding information about the time when the trace was written and the logged application, user and session. For each tracer in the tracerCollection its trace(State) method is called to produce the desired tracing. It only traces if tracingStatus is true.

Parameters:
state - State object that contains the information to be traced in traces based on states instead of actions.

setTracingStatus

public void setTracingStatus(boolean tracingStatus)
Sets the tracingStatus to the specified boolean value. This value will be true by default and setting it to false will easily stop the tracing system.

Parameters:
tracingStatus - boolean expression whose value will be assigned to the tracingStatus field

getTracingStatus

public boolean getTracingStatus()
Gets the value of the tracingStatus, which will determine whether the TracingEngine is tracing or not by means of a boolean.

Returns:
the boolean value of the tracingStatus field

getUser

public java.lang.String getUser()
Gets the user of the application.

Returns:
string representing the person who is using the application and whose actions are being traced

Sets the user of the application to the specified value.

Parameters:
user - string representing the person who is using the application and whose actions are being traced

string which represents the logged session

Parameters:
